moves.1... c5: Sicilliance defence, at the GM level most contrubuted opening
moves.5. Nxc6 bxc6 6. Bd3 e5 7. O-O Nf6 8. Nc3: 9. Be3 is not so well, white thinks to place his Knight on attackable 'g' file
moves.11. f4: good move, now black's 'e' pawn forces to capture
moves.11... Qb6+ 12. Kh1 exf4 13. Rxf4 Rae8: this is mistake, because his Rook on f8 and Bishop on e7 fully blocked, 13..d5 is playable to breakout white's development
moves.14... h6: this not a playable move he have to play 14.. Nxh5
moves.15. Nxf6+ Bxf6 16. Rxf6: is it quiet better to exchange a Rook for a Bishop?? It is good move. white thinks to open black's 'g' file for attacking
moves.16... gxf6 17. Qh5: why not 17. Bxh6? It can't make better attack. so 17.Qh5 is good to attack
moves.17... Bc8: black's idea to place his Rook on e5 but 17..Rb8  looks better
moves.18... Qd4 19. Be3: it is just for moving his Rook on f1
moves.19... Qxb2 20. Rf1 Re6 21. Bc4 Qe5: he can't move Rook from e5, if ..Re8 or Re5 22. Qg6+ Kh8 23. Qxf6+ Kh7 24. Bxf7 or Bh6 most stronger
moves.22. Bxe6 fxe6: if 22..Bxe6 23. Rf3 Bg4 24. Rg3 Qa1+ 25. Bg1
